basics.name: Wonkwon Raymond Lee
basics.summary: A prospective PhD in Computer Science with a focus on trustworthy AI and differential privacy. Currently an engineer in LG.

work.name: LG CNS America
work.summary: System engineer focused on network infrastructure design and optimization; Python automation and network monitoring.

work.name: PricewaterhouseCoopers
work.summary: Implemented a BERT-based relation extraction model fine-tuned on the TACRED dataset using PyTorch, and deployed models to AWS cloud platforms.
highlights: Defined data annotation, machine learning pipelines, and testing strategy

work.name: New York University, Center for Responsible AI
work.summary: Conducted research in Differentially Private synthetic data generation under Professor Julia Stoyanovich and contributed to a publication in PVLDB Vol. 16.
highlights: Best Paper Runner-Up Award at VLDB 2023
Replicated ICPSR papers with public and privatized data

work.name: New York University, McDevitt Lab
work.summary: Performed diagnostic prediction modeling research using machine learning for the Colgate project.
highlights: Preprocessed and visualized complex biomarker data using SQL and R

work.name: University of Manchester
work.summary: Implemented a Spiking Neural Network simulator and conducted simulations to analyze neuronal networks.
highlights: Thesis selected as one of the Best Computer Science Project Papers in 2018

work.name: Korea University, Wireless Intelligence at Network Edge Lab
work.summary: Participated in a drone simulation project under Professor Hwangnam Kim, implementing real-time optimization using MATLAB.

publications.name: Epistemic Parity: Reproducibility as an Evaluation Metric for Differential Privacy
publications.summary: Co-authored publication on reproducibility metrics for differential privacy.

publications.name: Epistemic Parity: Reproducibility as an Evaluation Metric for Differential Privacy
publications.summary: Co-authored research on differential privacy evaluation metrics.

publications.name: Out of Distribution Performance of State-of-the-Art Vision Models
publications.summary: Research on the out-of-distribution performance of state-of-the-art vision models.

awards.title: 2024 SIGMOD Highlight Award
awards.comment: Honored to work with Julia Stoyanovich and collaborators on this project.

awards.title: 2024 VLDB Best Experiment, Analysis & Benchmark Paper Runner-up
KMA Landslide Prediction Big Data Contest

references.name: Julia Stoyanovich
references.position: Associate Professor, Computer Science and Engineering
